com.canoo.dolphin

Interface BeanManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BeanManagerImpl

    public interface BeanManager

    The BeanManager defined the low level API of the Dolphin Platform to create synchronized models. A model instance that is created by using the bean manager will automatically synchronized between the client and server.

    In the Dolphin Platform architecture an application is normally defined by several MVC groups with a server side controller, a client side view and a synchronized presentation model. The BeanManager defines the basic mechanism to handle synchronized models and can be used in the MVC group to mutate the defined model or as a standalone API to create any kind of synchronized model.

    When using the MVC API of Dolphin Platform the lifecycle of the model is defined by the MVC group and the model will automatically be removed when the MVC group is removed. If the BeanManager is used as standalone API the developer must handle the lifecycle of the models and removePresentationModel them by using the BeanManager

    All synchronized models must follow some specific rules that are described in the DolphinBean annotation

    By using the default Spring or JavaEE implementation of the Dolphin platform the BeanManager will be provided as a managed bean and can be injected wherever the container allows injection.

    To create a new model the BeanManager provides the create(Class) method that is defined as a factory method for any kind of model. A model should never be instantiated by hand because in that case the model won't be synchronized between client and server. Here is an example how a model can be created: 

         MyModel model = beanManager.create(MyModel.class);

    The BeanManager provides several methods to observe the creation and deletion of models. One example is the onAdded(Class, com.canoo.dolphin.event.BeanAddedListener) method. All the methods are for using lambdas and therefore a handler can be easily added with only one line if code: 

         beanManager.onAdded(MyModel.class, model -> System.out.println("Model of type MyModel added"));
    There are no method to removePresentationModel registered handler from the BeanManager. Here Dolphin Platform implement an approach by using the Subscription Pattern: Each hander registration returns a Subscription instance that provides the Subscription.unsubscribe() method to removePresentationModel the handler.

    To deleta a synchronized model the BeanManager provides several methods. Here a developer can for example choose to delete a specific instance (see #remove(Object)) or all instances for a given type (see #removeAll(Class)).

    • Method Detail

      • create

        <T> T create(Class<T> beanClass)
        Creates a new instance of the given dolphin bean class that will automatically be synced with the client. The given class must be defined as a dolphin bean
        Type Parameters:
        T - bean type
        Parameters:
        beanClass - the bean class
        Returns:
        the new bean instance

      • findAll

        @Deprecated
<T> List<T> findAll(Class<T> beanClass)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a list of all dolphin managed beans of the given type / class
        Type Parameters:
        T - the bean type
        Parameters:
        beanClass - the bean type
        Returns:
        a list of all managed beans of the type

      • onAdded

        @Deprecated
<T> Subscription onAdded(Class<T> beanClass,
                                     BeanAddedListener<? super T> listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Subscribe a listener to all bean creation events for a specific class. A listener that is added to a client side BeanManager will only fire events for beans that where created on the server side and vice versa. This means that the listener isn't fired for a bean that was created by the same BeanManager.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the bean type
        Parameters:
        beanClass - the class for which creation events should be received
        listener - the listener which receives the creation-events
        Returns:
        the (@link com.canoo.dolphin.event.Subscription} that can be used to unsubscribe the listener
